title: Geometry — Set 1: Lines, Angles & Triangles
description: Elementary geometry questions about angles and basic triangle theorems.

questions.q: In a triangle the angles are in ratio 2:3:4. Find the largest angle.
questions.hint: Angles add to 180°, split in parts 2+3+4.
questions.explanation: Total parts =9, largest =4/9 ×180 =80? Wait compute: 4/9*180 = 80. So correct is 80°.

questions.q: If two parallel lines are cut by a transversal, corresponding angles are:
questions.hint: Corresponding angles occupy the same relative position.
questions.explanation: Corresponding angles are equal when lines are parallel.
